meanings.definition: Move along lightly, stepping from one foot to the other with a hop or bounce.
meanings.sent1: The children were skipping happily in the park.
meanings.sent2: She enjoys skipping rope during recess.
meanings.sent3: The bunny was caught skipping through the garden.
meanings.sent4: Her heart was skipping with excitement as she approached the finish line.
meanings.sent5: The skipping stones created ripples in the pond.

meanings.definition: Omit or disregard (something) in speaking or writing.
meanings.sent1: Please avoid skipping any important details in your report.
meanings.sent2: He was accused of skipping over crucial information in his presentation.
meanings.sent3: The detective couldn't help but notice the suspect's habit of skipping key facts.
meanings.sent4: Her mind kept skipping over the same paragraph in the book.
meanings.sent5: Skipping any steps in the recipe could ruin the dish.

meanings.definition: Fail to attend or deal with (something) as a result of negligence or forgetfulness.
meanings.sent1: I ended up skipping the meeting due to a scheduling conflict.
meanings.sent2: She regretted skipping her dentist appointment.
meanings.sent3: The student was caught skipping class for the third time this week.
meanings.sent4: His mind was skipping over the fact that the deadline was approaching.
meanings.sent5: Skipping the warning signs led to a disastrous outcome.
